causes: Title VII (including PDA), 42 U.S.C.  ยง 2000e

case_data.name: EEOC v. Bankcard America, Inc.
case_data.plaintiff_description: Equal Employment Opportunity Commission, on behalf of one or more workers.
settlement_agreement: Court Approved Settlement or Consent Decree
case_data.summary: In March 1997, the Chicago office of the EEOC brought this suit against Bankcard America, Inc. in the U.S. District Court for the Northern District of Illinois. The court dismissed the case for failure to prosecute in May 1998. The court reinstated the case in May 1998, and the case settled by entry of a consent decree in the same month. The information pertaining to the nature of the suit is not known for certain but the docket suggests that the case was brought under Title VII.
